camel.sink.endpoint.command.name: camel.sink.endpoint.command
camel.sink.endpoint.command.description: put means to put the job into Beanstalk. Job body is specified in the Camel message body. Job ID will be returned in beanstalk.jobId message header. delete, release, touch or bury expect Job ID in the message header beanstalk.jobId. Result of the operation is returned in beanstalk.result message header kick expects the number of jobs to kick in the message body and returns the number of jobs actually kicked out in the message header beanstalk.result. One of: [bury] [release] [put] [touch] [delete] [kick]

camel.sink.endpoint.jobPriority.name: camel.sink.endpoint.jobPriority
camel.sink.endpoint.jobPriority.description: Job priority. (0 is the highest, see Beanstalk protocol)

camel.sink.endpoint.jobTimeToRun.name: camel.sink.endpoint.jobTimeToRun
camel.sink.endpoint.jobTimeToRun.description: Job time to run in seconds. (when 0, the beanstalkd daemon raises it to 1 automatically, see Beanstalk protocol)

camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.name: camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer
camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.component.beanstalk.lazyStartProdu.name: camel.component.beanstalk.lazyStartProducer
camel.component.beanstalk.lazyStartProdu.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.component.beanstalk.autowiredEnabl.name: camel.component.beanstalk.autowiredEnabled
camel.component.beanstalk.autowiredEnabl.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.

camel.component.beanstalk.connectionSett.name: camel.component.beanstalk.connectionSettingsFactory
camel.component.beanstalk.connectionSett.description: Custom ConnectionSettingsFactory. Specify which ConnectionSettingsFactory to use to make connections to Beanstalkd. Especially useful for unit testing without beanstalkd daemon (you can mock ConnectionSettings)
